attributes.action:
Dentist should be able to administer Covid -19
Vaccine
attributes.background:
We are experiencing the worst phase of the dreaded pandemic. The cases are on steep upward curve allow dental professionals to provide the Vaccine. Dentists are qualified to administer injections and we are happy to help
There must not be any restrictions that only NHS Dentist are able to do so.

rejection.details:
Dentists are already able to apply to be Covid-19 Vaccinators. As with all vaccinators, dentists would need to meet certain requirements in order to become vaccintors. You can find out more about how to support the Covid-19 vaccination programme here: https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/join-the-nhs-covid-19-vaccine-team/

The training recommendations for Covid-19 vaccinators are set by Public Health England, and the application process for joining the NHS Covid-19 vaccinaton team is managed by the NHS. Both Public Health England and the NHS are operationally independent of the Government, and decisions about this guidance and recruitment are matters for them, not the Government or House of Commons.
